title:"Baglog's Educational and Overly Verbose Wish List"
description:"Long notes highlighting reasoning for each pick designed for the perk novice. Seperate descriptions for PvP and PvE. Shout-out to Silverstarr and Pugbart <3"

//
// *****TEST SECTION*****

// **************************BEGIN REGULAR WEAPONS***************************
//

//*****AUTO RIFLES*****

// Arctic Haze
//notes:controller (PvP): For PvP, the most interesting perk combo seems to be Killing Wind and Thresh, allowing you to go on killing sprees and work into your super faster. Outlaw gets a notable mention in the first slot as well. For barrels, I'm going to want either Arrowhead Brake to help correct the atrocious recoil stat of 42. In the second column I am going to take flared magwell first, then accurized, because I value stability highly. |tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=839105230,3230963543,2450788523,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=3661387068,3230963543,2450788523,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=1482024992,3230963543,2450788523,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=839105230,3142289711,2450788523,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=3661387068,3142289711,2450788523,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=1482024992,3142289711,2450788523,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=839105230,106909392,2450788523,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=3661387068,106909392,2450788523,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=1482024992,106909392,2450788523,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=839105230,3230963543,168162263,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=3661387068,3230963543,168162263,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=1482024992,3230963543,168162263,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=839105230,3142289711,168162263,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=3661387068,3142289711,168162263,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=1482024992,3142289711,168162263,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=839105230,106909392,168162263,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=3661387068,106909392,168162263,2726471870
dimwishlist:item=20935540&perks=1482024992,106909392,168162263,2726471870

//Chroma Rush:
//notes: Our first 720 Kinetic AR in a while. It has decent stability, a nice vertical recoil direction of 45 (so no counterbalance), and an absurb amount of base aim assist (80). For PvP the base TTK is .77s with 9C1B. Kill Clip is the clear winner: 6C2B gets you an absurd .60 TTK. Rampage isn't bad, though, and with x1 it drops to a very fast .67 TTK with 9 crits. Rampage is also generally better for PvE, so it is the overall top pick for the 4th column. In column 3, Tunnel vision has very good synergy with Kill Clip, as does Feeding Frenzy. For PvP, do not sleep on _Moving Target_: +10 Aim Assist brings you up to 90 base, and with a targeting perk you can be looking at 100 AA on a bullet hose. Top picks are FF, Subsistence, and Heating Up. I personally find that on fast firing guns I don't notice the extra few bullets from Subsistence, so honorable mention to Dynamic Sway Reduction. For mags and barrels try not to hurt any stat if possible, especially range, but also stability. Corkscrew Barrel or Arrowhead Brake are top picks, along with Accurized Rounds or Tactical Mag. Baglog's personal God Roll: Arrowhead Brake, Accurized Rounds, Feeding Frenzy, Rampage.

dimwishlist:item=1119734784&perks=839105230,3142289711,2779035018,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=1119734784&perks=4090651448,3142289711,2779035018,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=1119734784&perks=1840239774,3142289711,2779035018,3425386926

//Chrysura Melo
//Notes:PvP:Multikill Clip reduces TTK from .83 to .67 and so it a highly desirable perk. Does not need counterbalance. 
dimwishlist:item=1337707096&perks=1570042021,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=1337707096&perks=1168162263,2458213969

//Notes:Pve:Frenzy is the best choice overall, but you could make a good case for either Multikillclip or Thresh, which also has Synergy with Encore.

//
//The Forward Path
//notes:"PvP: There are two ways to play this AR: standard and SMG. As a kinetic AR, Iron Grip and Dynamic Sway Reduction is probably the best all around combination. Other standout combinations are Dynamic Sway Reduction and Tap the Trigger and Feeding Frenzy with Multi-Kill Clip. With Iron Gaze, the gun behaves more like a 600 RPM precision SMG. Dynamic Sway Reduction or Hip Fire Grip will push the aim assist up to 100.  
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=3230963543,1359896290,11551321
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=106909392,1359896290,11551321
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=3142289711,1359896290,11551321
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=3142289711,1359896290,1890422124
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=1968497646,1359896290,1890422124
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=106909392,1359896290,1890422124
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=3142289711,2779035018,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=106909392,2779035018,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=3230963543,2779035018,2458213969

//note:"PvE: Not too many reasons to use this in PvE. Look for MKC or Swashbuckler and lots of ammo. Pulse monitor is not terrible here either."
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=2779035018,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=2779035018,4082225868

dimwishlist:item=1690783811&perks=1631667848,4082225868
//
//False Promises
//notes:"PvP: There is no reason to use this archetype in PvP until it gets a buff. Interesting perk combos to hold onto include Killing Wind and Rampage (Kill streaks), Dynamic Sway Reduction and Zen Moment (make it a laser), Threat Detector and Swashbuckler (finish in Melee range). Underdog and Eye of the Storm are synergistic, but I'm not sure it's powerful enough to be worth using. Mag choice will almost always be Ricochet Rounds, but High Cal and Flared Magwell are not terrible. Recoil direction is 86 so no need to focus there."
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1885400500,2450788523,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1885400500,1359896290,2387244414
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1885400500,4071163871,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1885400500,205890336,699525795
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1561002382,2450788523,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1561002382,1359896290,2387244414
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1561002382,4071163871,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1561002382,205890336,699525795
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=3230963543,2450788523,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=3230963543,1359896290,2387244414
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=3230963543,4071163871,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=3230963543,205890336,699525795
//

//notes:PvE:This gun is very usable in PvP right now. At the top of the list is Overflow/Rampage with any magazine-increasing perk. Sympathetic Arsenal and Feeding Frenzy are a great choice. I am not normally a fan of Subsistence, but pairing with Unrelenting turns you into an add-slaying machine. Overflow and Surrounded could be good in certain boss engagements to get a large damage boost with the only requirement is keeping 2 adds up.
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=2420895100,3643424744,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1087426260,3643424744,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1968497646,3643424744,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1561002382,3643424744,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=3230963543,2779035018,3350417888
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=679225683,2779035018,3350417888
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1968497646,1820235745,3108830275
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1561002382,1820235745,3108830275
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1885400500,1820235745,3108830275
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=2420895100,3643424744,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1087426260,3643424744,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3143732432&perks=1968497646,3643424744,3708227201

//
//Gnawing Hunger
//notes:"In PvP Kill Clip will remain king. Pair it with Zen Moment or Tap the Trigger if you can learn to burst fire. For magazines steady rounds is preferred. For barrels if you you have a stability masterwork then range-enhancing perks such as Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, or Extended Barrel are great choices. Otherwise look to buff stability. Arrowhead break + a CB mod will push recoil direction to 99. When paired with Zen Moment it can turn this gun into a laser. Niche melee-focused builds will want to pair TtT with Swashbucker to better support putting in a packet. Used Fluted Barrel or anything else that increases handling. Baglog's personal pick: Arrowhead break, steady rounds, zen moment, kill clip."
dimwishlist:item=821154603&perks=839105230,3177308360,2387244414,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=821154603&perks=2387244414,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=821154603&perks=1890422124,4082225868

//notes:"In PvE the curated roll is possibly the best roll for the gun with the combination of Overflow and Rampage. Otherwise, Subsistence and Rampage is likely the best combo for general use. Demolitionist and Autoloading Holster is not as redundant as it might seem due to longer grenade cooldowns. For high-end content the best bet is most-likely ALH and Demolitionist too ensure the gun is always full and grenades are always recharging. Field prep gets honorable mention. Baglog's pick (other than curated): Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, ALH, Demolitionist."
dimwishlist:item=821154603&perks=1840239774,2420895100,3300816228,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=821154603&perks=1820235745,3425386926

//Uriel's Gift
//notes:"PvP: Precision ARs are not the best in the current meta. There is no reason not to shoor for Ricochet rounds, although stead rounds is a close second. Uriel's has a decent perk pool for a dueling weapon. In the first column we have DSR, Firmly Planted, and Quickdraw. In the second column Kill Clip, Tap the Trigger, and Moving Target are all solid picks. Under-pressure is not amazing because of having to get more than 15 rounds into the magazine to notice it."
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1885400500,1359896290,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1885400500,1359896290,1890422124
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1885400500,1359896290,588594999
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1885400500,280464955,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1885400500,280464955,1890422124
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1885400500,280464955,588594999
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1885400500,706527188,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1885400500,706527188,588594999
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1885400500,706527188,1890422124

//notes:"PvE: Shield Disorient is the most interesting perk for PvE. Pair with Field Prep or Triple Tap. For mags Armor Piercing is a top pick, with either Appended Mag or Hi-Cal as acceptable alternatives."
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1968497646,2869569095,3275789089
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1968497646,3400784728,3275789089
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1087426260,2869569095,3275789089
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1087426260,3400784728,3275789089
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1561002382,2869569095,3275789089
dimwishlist:item=3863882743&perks=1561002382,3400784728,3275789089

//Seventh Seraph Carbine
//notes:"(PvP) A very shallow perk pool, only a few options worth having. For barrels, chambered compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted, or Small Bore. For magazines it's really only steady rounds. For PvP, slideshot is really the only viable option. Threat Detector has some synergy with Swashbuckler. In the second column the top pick is either Rangefinder or Moving Target for PvP."
dimwishlist:item=1561006927&perks=3661387068,1885400500,3161816588,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=1561006927&perks=1467527085,1885400500,3161816588,2846385770

//
// Whispering Slab
//notes:"PvP & PvE: lean into Run'n'Gun & fast swap playstyles. String: Elastic or Polymer. Shaft: Straight Fletching or Fiberglass Arrow. Perks: Quickdraw, Hipfire, or Killing Wind paired with Opening Shot or Sympathetic Arsenal. Swashbuckler is hilarious but gimicky."    
dimwishlist:item=211938782&perks=2801223209,3429800428,706527188,47981717
dimwishlist:item=211938782&perks=2801223209,3429800428,706527188,3350417888
dimwishlist:item=211938782&perks=2801223209,3429800428,1866048759,47981717
dimwishlist:item=211938782&perks=2801223209,3429800428,1866048759,3350417888
dimwishlist:item=211938782&perks=2801223209,3429800428,2450788523,47981717

//PvP Picks
//notes: "For PvP, stability barrels are king. Particle repeater or projection fuse, depending on masterwork. Avoid liquid coils it does not reduce bolts to kill (5). Perk combos: Quickdraw/Backup Plan is intriguing-Mindbender with 20m range? Killing wind and Backup Plan for easy doubles. Under Pressure and Disruption Break would pair well. Slideways + Backup Plan could also provide shotgun-like play style."

// Orewing's Maul
//notes: (PvP/Controller): There is almost no reason to use this in PvP as long as Truthteller is available. The only unique roll is with Rangefinder. Pairing that with max Blast Radius Perks and Proximity Grenades, will make the gun more Mountain-top ish. Your best bets for barrels are  Volatile Launch or Linear Compensator. We don't care about handling because of Quickdraw. Use a Quick Access Sling mod.|tags:PvP,Controller
dimwishlist:item=2108920981&perks=1441682018,409831596,706527188,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=2108920981&perks=1478423395,409831596,706527188,2846385770

//Truthteller
//notes:"PvP: Lot of potentially good rolls on this gun. Feeding Frenzy is the standout perk in slot 1. Disruption Break or Multikill Clip are standout perks in slot 2. Demolitionist and Quickdraw are also very usable. With proximity grenades you do not have to hold the trigger to control detonation time, making it the best choice for swap playstyles."

//
// *****PULSE RIFLES****

//Cold Denial
//PvP God Roll
//notes:Baglog's 2 God Rolls for PvP: Arrowhead Break, Ricochet Rounds, Zen Moment or Killing Wind and Headseeker to produce the most consistent gun possible and mitigate the overall clunkiness of the archetype with high handling. Stability or Handling Masterwork.
dimwishlist:item=1216130969&perks=839105230,1885400500,2387244414,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1216130969&perks=839105230,1885400500,2450788523,460017080

//PvP Rolls
//notes: (PvP/Controller): For PvP we are prioritizing handling and stability. The low zoom of the sight mean you are going to be playing more in autorifle range, so headseeker is useful to help save the burst and get optimal TTK. The base recoil is 73, so you can use a recoil-control barrel to help dampen that even further if you feel it's necessary. Zen Moment is really good on this archetype, as is Killing Wind, and Feeding Frenzy isn't a bad perk to live with, especially in conjunction with Multikill Clip. In the last column it's really just Headseeker and Multikill Clip.|tags:PvP,Controller

//notes: (PvE/Controller): For PvE there are a few interesting perk combinations to try out. Feeding Frenzy and either MultiKill CLip or Sympathetic Arsenal synergize well. Pulse Monitor and Sympathetic Arsenal can provide a "Dragon's Shadow Lite" combination that would pair well with slow reloading specials, as would Killing Wind and Sympathetic Arsenal. Threat Detector is more useful in PvE settings where you are less immediately dead by having the wrong weapon out for the engagement range. Finally, Unrelenting is useful either with Feeding Frenzy or possibly even Pulse Monitor to keep the fun rolling. We want reload and handing barrels and mags. Don't ever pass up Ricochet Rounds though.|tags:PvE,Controller

//The Grid Skipper
//Notes:PvP: Multikill Clip decreases the TTK to .67 so it's worth holding on to. Best pairing would be Tunnel Vision. There is a 3m damage drop-off difference with a max range version at 36m.
dimwishlist:item=1621558458&perks=2458213969

//Notes:Baglog's personal PvP God Roll, ideally with range masterwork.
dimwishlist:item=1621558458&perks=839105230,1885400500,2946784966,2458213969


//The Time-Worn Spire
//Notes:PvP: Rampage is the overall best in slot choice, with an honorable mention to Iron Grip. Moving Target is going to be your best bet for helping your peek game and to push the aim assist up to a base 89. Try different scopes but it's worth pointing out that the Rifle Scope ST pushes the base ADS range all the way out to 44 meters. PvE: just use your roll with Rampage if you must.

dimwishlist:item=3593598010&perks=3425386926
dimwishlist:item=3593598010&perks=11551321
dimwishlist:item=3593598010&perks=588594999
dimwishlist:item=3593598010&perks=706527188

//
// *****SCOUT RIFLES****
//
//Night Watch
//notes:PvP: Barrels: Chambered Compensator + Counterbalance Mod gives a respectable 82 recoil direction. Other barrel options are Small Bore, Corkscrew, or Fluted. Arrowhead Break is probably overkill but will make recoil perfectly vertical with CB mod. For magazines, Drop Mag is a very viable choice as it brings base reload up to 89. Otherwise, Steady Rounds > Flared Magwell > Tactical Mag. Perk combos: MKC drops optimal TTK to .6 with only 1 stack. Moving Target will help hit Optimal TTK, and Explosive Rounds can help flinch out a win in a duel. Outlaw is going to be the preferred choice, with Rapid Hit as a close second given an optimal kill requires 3C. Threat detector can be very valuable while someone is closing the gap and not yet in range of your secondary. Baglog's chase roll: DM, SR, TD, MKC, Stability or Reload MW.
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=3661387068,4134353779,4071163871,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=3661387068,4134353779,4071163871,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=3230963543,1168162263,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=3230963543,1168162263,588594999
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=3230963543,1168162263,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=106909392,1168162263,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=106909392,1168162263,588594999
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=106909392,1168162263,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=4134353779,4071163871,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=4134353779,247725512,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=4134353779,1168162263,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=3177308360,1168162263,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=3177308360,1168162263,588594999
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=3177308360,1168162263,3038247973

//notes:PvE: Range > Stability, with Larger mags. Threat detector becomes more valuable because mobs are closer and it's safer to reload. Overflow + Rampage is the overwhelmingly best choice, but Rapid Hit/MKC is a close second because MKC is chainable so reloading is more valuable. Depending on your special, Overflow/Explosive Rounds might be useful for hip-firing adds if you get swarmed. Edit: it looks like Overflow/Explosive Rounds is the curated roll from Reckoning. Rapid hit Rampage and Threat detector rampage tied for second. Baglog's chase roll: Extended Barrel, Extended Mag, Threat Detector or Rapid Hit, MKC. 
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=1087426260,3643424744,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=1087426260,3643424744,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=1087426260,3643424744,3038247973

dimwishlist:item=3504336176&perks=2420895100,3643424744,3038247973

//
// Stars in Shadows
//
// Stars in Shadow
//notes:Baglog (PvP, Controller): Many great rolls with this gun. For PvP we are favoring stability to increase our chances to 2 burst and Handling to make it feel less clunky. Surplus is absolutely top tier, barely beating out Killing Wind, with honorable mention going to Quickdraw and Firmly Planted. Outlaw can shine with its classic pairing Kill Clip, but it's outclassed by perks that buff more than just reload. In the second perk column, Kill Clip is not all that exciting because it only lowers TTK by 0.07 seconds. Headseeker is a fantastic perk on pulse rifles to help "save the burst" and make it more consistent, and Moving Target makes strafing easier and +10 Aim Assist is always nice to have.|tags:PvP,Controller
dimwishlist:item=2050789284&perks=839105230,839105230,2450788523,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=2050789284&perks=1840239774,839105230,2450788523,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=2050789284&perks=1482024992,839105230,2450788523,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=2050789284&perks=839105230,3230963543,2450788523,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=2050789284&perks=1840239774,3230963543,2450788523,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=2050789284&perks=1482024992,3230963543,2450788523,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=2050789284&perks=839105230,3177308360,2450788523,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=2050789284&perks=1840239774,3177308360,2450788523,3523296417

//
// *****SHOTGUNS****
//

//First in, Last Out
//Assault Mag, Slideshot, Opening Shot (PvP).
//notes:"PvP: There is no quickdraw so don't hurt handling. Fluted or corkscrew is ideal. Assault Mag is preferred, with either accurized or light mag as alternate choices. Perk combos: slideshot/opening shot. Mouse and keyboard can also run hip fire/opening shot."
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=4090651448,791862061,3161816588,47981717
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=1840239774,791862061,3161816588,47981717
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=1840239774,791862061,1866048759,47981717
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=202670084,3142289711,1866048759,47981717
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=3250034553,3142289711,1866048759,47981717


//PvE rolls
//notes:"PvE: Range doesn't matter as much so go for handling, mag size, and reload perks. Barrels: Corkscrew, fluted, or smallbore.Tactical mag preferred, appended and extended give the same amount. For perks, in the left column we are only interested in Pulse Monitor and Auto=Loading Holster. In the right, Demolitionist, Surrounded, and Vorpal Weapon."
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=4090651448,106909392,972757866,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=4090651448,106909392,972757866,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=4090651448,106909392,972757866,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=1840239774,106909392,972757866,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=1840239774,106909392,972757866,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=1840239774,106909392,972757866,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=4090651448,106909392,3300816228,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=4090651448,106909392,3300816228,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=4090651448,106909392,3300816228,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=1840239774,106909392,3300816228,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=1840239774,106909392,3300816228,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3616586446&perks=1840239774,106909392,3300816228,1546637391

//Found Verdict
Notes:PvP:Has potential to be a great PvP shotgun. The roll to shoot for is slideshot and opening shot, but really opening shot is the must-have perk in column 4. Anything else is gravy. PvE: One-Two Punch is special this season so hold on to good rolls with this one. Rewind Rounds is likely the best in slot perk combo because it procs on hits, not kills. Autoloading Holster is always worth keeping one of as well.

dimwishlist:item=3197270240&perks=3161816588,47981717
dimwishlist:item=3197270240&perks=3418782618,2679249093
dimwishlist:item=3197270240&perks=3300816228

//Fractethyst
//Notes:PvP:ideally want Full choke and accurized or full choke and assault mag. Opening shot is likely best in slot. Pair with quickdraw, slideshot, or ensemble.
dimwishlist:item=3184681056&perks=706527188,47981717
dimwishlist:item=3184681056&perks=2621346526,47981717
dimwishlist:item=3184681056&perks=3161816588,47981717

//Notes:PvE:Given the high cost of scavenger mods now, Lead from Gold has increased in value. This is also the only kinetic shotgun that can roll trench barrel right now.
dimwishlist:item=3184681056&perks=1556840489,2360754333

//Notes:Hold on to an adrenaline junkie version since they said it was going to get buffed.
dimwishlist:item=3184681056&perks=706527188,11612903
dimwishlist:item=3184681056&perks=25606670,11612903

//Notes:Baglog's personal God Roll.
dimwishlist:item=3184681056&perks=1047830412,3142289711,706527188,47981717


//Hawthorne's Field-Forged Shotgun
//notes:(PvP): The big draw is Opening Shot. When combined with Firmly Planted you get the best chance of a 1HK at range while crouching in the corner like a little bitch or sliding. Assault Mag + Full Auto is another option to basically lean into 2 taps. In that case, it doesn't matter as much what the second perk is... Demolitionist is never awful, even if you are going to always want opening shot.|tags:PvP
dimwishlist:item=1807343361&perks=1332244541,791862061,280464955,47981717
dimwishlist:item=1807343361&perks=1482024992,791862061,280464955,47981717
dimwishlist:item=1807343361&perks=1047830412,791862061,280464955,47981717

//notes: (PvE): We can be less picky with barrels- anything besides full choke is fine. You will likely not want rifled barrel either but it isn't going to kill you. In the second column look for Demolitionist and One-Two Punch. |tags:PvE

//Riiswalker
//notes: PvP: Rapid-fire archetype and successor to Hawthorne's Field-Forged Shotgun. in Column 4 look for Iron Reach first, with Killing Wind worth trying and possibly even Swashbuckler because with this archetype and a ranged melee getting one shot in and following up with a melee is not too hard to pull off, except that Felwinter's exists. Column 3 is still all about Quickdraw, although Surplus might be a better choice depending on your build and playstyle. Firmly Planted is no slideshot, but it can do in a pinch. 
dimwishlist:item=108221785&perks=591790007
dimwishlist:item=108221785&perks=2450788523

dimwishlist:item=108221785&perks=706527188
dimwishlist:item=108221785&perks=3436462433
dimwishlist:item=108221785&perks=280464955


//notes:PvE: There is not much here that stands out. If you really want a non-sunset kinetic lightweight shotgun for some reason, you probably really only care about Vorpal, Demolitionist, and Swashbuckler.
dimwishlist:item=108221785&perks=1546637391
dimwishlist:item=108221785&perks=3523296417
dimwishlist:item=108221785&perks=4082225868


//Seventh Seraph CQC-12
//notes: (PvP): Quickdraw and snapshot is king. Even better if you get one with vorpal weapon on it as well. Be on the lookout for Slideshot and Snapshot as well. With Quickdraw you can ignore handling and go for range-extending perks. With slideshot you really want full choke on the barrel. I like Assault mag because it plays into the two-tap strength of these guns, although you won't be too sad with rangefinder or even Light Mag.

//notes: (PvE): Shield disorient is the most unique and potentially useful perk in the pool. Auto-loading holster is very good, and Lead From Gold can help by allowing you to stack heavy ammo finders. Range is not as important as handling or reload. In additional, all of the mag enhancers cap at 7 shots max so go for Tactical Mag. To test: does the Trench Barrel (2360754333) damage window fit all 3 shots in at base RPM and/or with assault mag? If not, remove it from wish list.|tags:PvE

//Sojourner's Tale
Notes:PvP: Tunnel vision and killing wind is a unique perk combo for this gun. Coolguy likes it a lot. Quickdraw and Opening Shot is also obviously great. PvE: Auto-loading and Frenzy is probably the best PvE roll.

dimwishlist:item=599895591&perks=2946784966,2450788523
dimwishlist:item=599895591&perks=706527188,47981717
dimwishlist:item=599895591&perks=3300816228,4104185692

//
// *****SIDEARMS*****
//
//Brass Attacks
Notes:PvP: not a very deep perk pool, so easy to get a good roll. Rampage is the best damage boosting perk for PvP- Frenzy is more of a PvE perk. The difference between high range and low range in this archetype is about .5 meter (as of S13) so it's safe to go with what feels good.
// Brass Attacks

//notes: Baglog's personal PvP God Roll
dimwishlist:item=2121785039&perks=3250034553,1885400500,247725512,3425386926

//Enigma's Draw
//notes:"PvP:Precision frame sidearms have a competitive and forgiving optimal TTK of .7s with 2C 2B. The only damage-boosting perk on Enigma's Draw is Swashbuckler, which turns it into a 3 bullet kill after a melee. Given you only need 4 shots to kill, Opening Shot helps you ensure that at least one of your 4 bullets is a crit. Paired with Rangefinder, you can build a mini-handcannon with a ton of range. This is really the only reason to use this gun in PvP, otherwise just use Lonesome which is easier to farm in Season 11. Not worth using at all in PvE."
dimwishlist:item=1723380073&perks=1885400500,4267945040,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=1723380073&perks=3142289711,47981717,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=1723380073&perks=1885400500,1631667848,4082225868

//Fool's Remedy
//notes:"PvP: The Suros Rapid Fire frame is tied for 3rd with the Lightweight frame to have an optimal TTK of .67s. The Suros frame is less forgiving, needing 5C1B vs. 3C2B for the Lightweight. At very low accuracy (50% or less) the Suros frame is slightly faster (0.03 - 0.07s), but that's not going to make or break the gun. Our best perk combos are going to improve accuracy (more head shots) while still playing to a sidearm's strength: out-maneuvering shotgun rushers. The 2 best perk combos are going to be Hipfire and Iron Gaze or Moving Target and Iron Grip. For MT/IG you want a masterwork other than stability unless you want to use a ranged sight that hurts stability. For magazines, the superior choice is steady rounds unless you have an exotic that buffs reload somehow, then I would pick Extended Mag because why the heck not? All sights provide the same amount of AA, so aim for stability to improve your target tracking. Control > Quickdot > Shortspec. Baglog's pick: Farpoint SAS, Ricochet Rounds, Moving Target, Iron Grip, Stability Masterwork."
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755710,1885400500,588594999,11551321
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755707,1885400500,588594999,11551321
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755706,1885400500,588594999,11551321
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755705,1885400500,588594999,11551321
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755707,1885400500,1866048759,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755706,1885400500,1866048759,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755705,1885400500,1866048759,4152709778

//notes:"PvP:I could be convinced that Pulse Monitor with either Iron Gaze or Iron Grip improves your duels vs. non-shotgun opponents because the magazine is relatively small and the reload is abysmal so getting more bullets mid-fight can tip the scale in your favor. If you main a healing exotic (One-Eyed Mask, Workhusk Crown) then Pulse Monitor and Kill Clip becomes much more attractive because you are almost immediately back in the fight with a full mag and an absurd TTK of .53 at 60% accuracy or better. On paper, Pulse Monitor and Eye of the Storm have potential synergy and might be a better choice for 3's. Baglog's pick: Control SAS, Ricochet Rounds, Pulse Monitor, Kill Clip."
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=445755706,1885400500,972757866,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=3230963543,972757866,11551321
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=3230963543,972757866,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=3230963543,972757866,699525795
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=1968497646,972757866,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=1561002382,972757866,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=1087426260,972757866,11551321
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=2420895100,972757866,11551321
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=1561002382,972757866,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=1087426260,972757866,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=2420895100,972757866,4152709778
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=1968497646,972757866,4152709778

//notes:"PvP:Kill Clip is always worth a look. Pair with Moving Target or Feeding Frenzy."
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=1885400500,588594999,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=1885400500,2779035018,1015611457


//notes:"PvE: This gun does not have a lot to offer. Avoid subsistence because this archetype blows through ammo and you will run out if you aren't careful. The most useful combo is going to be Feeding Frenzy with Kill Clip and a reload boosting magazine: Flared Magwell is your best choice because you want to reload as soon as you get the kill versus emptying the mag. This combo takes 2 clips to ramp up- one to get 3 stacks of FF and the second to go ham with KC activated, implying you need at least 6 adds to get the most value. Pulse monitor does trigger Kill Clip and may be potentially more useful except that if you are critically wounded you should heal instead of stick your neck out to use KC. The utility of this combo goes up if you use a healing exotic."
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=3230963543,2779035018,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=1087426260,2779035018,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=679225683,2779035018,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=2420895100,972757866,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=65611680&perks=1087426260,972757866,1015611457

//Last Hope
//notes:"PvP: Range doesn't matter for damage drop-off for these sidearms, but it still helps with reticle stickiness a bit. Control SAS and Ricochet Rounds gives 100 stability. If you have a stability masterwork you could also run Farpoint SAS to max out your range and still get 100 stability. Perk combos:FF/MKC, FF/TtT (increased accuracy), Quickdraw/MKC, QD/TtT. Rangefinder is fairly unique but I have no idea how valuable it is. Try it with MKC or TtT."
dimwishlist:item=3622137132&perks=445755706,1885400500,2779035018,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=3622137132&perks=445755706,1885400500,2779035018,1890422124

//Lonesome
//notes:PvP:Very consistent and forgiving archetype with 2C 2B needed to achieve optimal TTK of 0.7s. We really only care about Ricochet Rounds, Full Auto, and either Kill Clip, Swashbuckler, or Demolitionist, in that order.

//
//Ikelos_SR_V1.0.2
//PvP rolls
//notes:(PvP): Push range to max out stickiness without impacting handling too much. Best bet for barrels: Hammerforged, small bore, corkscrew. Mags: Seraph, Accurized, or Tactical. Perk combos: Moving Target/HIR. There is also the don't blink combo of No Distractions and  Box Breathing. We don't really need quickdraw, it's pretty snappy already."|tag:Favorite

//notes:(PvP): Seraph Rounds/Moving Target/Quickdraw is the True Vanguard PvP god roll. Barrels should most likely be stability-focused for easier follow up shots, although range may make it easier.
dimwishlist:item=1253087083&perks=1140096971,588594999,706527188

//notes:(PvE): Range is not as important as stability to make DPS phases easier. Barrels: Arrowhead break is worth trying with a CB mod. Chambered compensator or Small Bore is preferred. Mags preferences in order are Tactical, Appended, and Seraph Rounds. Perk combos are Fourth Time's the Charm or Triple Tap with High Impact Reserves or Disruption Break."

//
//Distant Tumulus
//PvE rolls
//notes:"For barrels for this RPM, stability and recoil direction help land follow-on shots. Chambered compensator is good, as well as small bore or even polygonal rifling. This is strictly a PvE sniper, so ammo capacity and reload speed are important. Tactical mag or Flared mag will be your best options. The only unique perk combination is Dragonfly/Firing Line. Genesis/Firing Line is possibly superior for the overall use case of plinking away at majors from a distance."
dimwishlist:item=2807687156&perks=106909392,2848615171,1771339417
dimwishlist:item=2807687156&perks=3230963543,2848615171,1771339417
dimwishlist:item=2807687156&perks=106909392,3096702027,1771339417
dimwishlist:item=2807687156&perks=3230963543,3096702027,1771339417

//
// *****SUBMACHINE GUNS****
//

//Death Adder
//PvP
//notes:" PvP notes: Tactical Mag or Accurized for Mags. The godroll is most likely Small Bore, Steady Rounds, DSR, and Rangefinder. Other perk combos: Mulligan could be good on a bullet hose. Try with Rangefinder, QD, or Disruption Break. DSR and FF are going to pair well with a variety of perks. PvE: don't use."
dimwishlist:item=2742490609&perks=1482024992,3177308360,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=2742490609&perks=106909392,3513791699,2846385770

dimwishlist:item=2742490609&perks=3177308360,1359896290,588594999

// Extraordinary Rendition
//notes: (PvP, PvE): Handling is above-average, so focus on increasing range and stability. Small bore and corkscrew are both top choices. For magazines similar story: help, don't hurt. Accurized is the top choice overall, with Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell making decent choices. Column 3 has many great perks, so really it is just a question of avoiding Outlaw and Firmly Planted. In the third column Frenzy is God-tier and everything else is just a placeholder until you get a roll with Frenzy. The only perks I am not sold on are One for All and Tap the Trigger. My chase roll: Smallbore, Accurized, Surplus, Frenzy.

// Ikelos_SMG_V1.0.2
//notes: (PvE/Controller): Seraph rounds are not nearly as important in PvE. The most common use for this gun is add clearing quickly to spawn Warmind cells to clear more adds. We are going to look for deeper magazines and faster reloads. For main perks, Threat Detector and Subsistence shine, with Disruption Break, Surrounded, and Demolitionist all making a good case. I don't really value Vorpal Weapon on this gun but I won't pitch one that has it.|tags:PvE,Controller

//Seventh Seraph VY-7
//notes:(PvP) Not a lot of great PvP rolls for this gun in an archetype that doesn't see much use. Reload and handling are both terrible, so look for mitigations to that. Pulse Monitor and Feeding Frenzy are decent, as well as Firm Planted and Feeding Frenzy. If you run a void subclass hold on to a Firmly Planted/Elemental Capacitor roll and try out the stability stacking.

//
// *****SWORDS*****
//
//all swords: Tireless Blade's perk means 'Whenever the sword has ammo' making it good for trash spamming. Charge rate is how long it takes for sword energy to come back. Guard endurance is how long you can hold the guard animation. Guard efficiency determines how fast your energy tanks while taking damage. Guard resistance is amount of damage prevented per shot. PvP: Efficiency and Resistance, PvE Efficiency and Endurance. 

//Honor's Edge
//notes:Best boss roll: Burst Guard, Relentless Strike, Flash Counter. Whack-whack-whack-block the stomp > boss is debuffed. Because this is a weapon-based debuff it will stack with other debuffs. Don't hold block too long, burst guard has very low endurance. Your role is debut first, damage second, so Enduring Blade > Hungry Edge > Tempered Edge. Honor's edge does not have whirlwind blade. Surrounded with Heavy guard is also a viable choice: aim for Jagged Edge in this case.
dimwishlist:item=2857348871&perks=1261178282,3625355092,1749209109,2244851822
dimwishlist:item=2857348871&perks=436053704,3625355092,1749209109,2244851822
dimwishlist:item=2857348871&perks=938542991,3625355092,1749209109,2244851822
dimwishlist:item=2857348871&perks=3666208348,2349202967,1749209109,3708227201

//notes:Boss debuff roll: The primary purpose of this build is to keep up Flash Counter and not die, even at the cost of personal DPS. Burst Guard, Energy Transfer, Flash Counter. Most useful on Hunter because dodge is OP, then Warlock (get bumped away, pop rift, do ranged damage until it's time to debuff again) and then Titan (get bounced away, pop a barricade, and heal or DPS at range from cover).
dimwishlist:item=2857348871&perks=1261178282,3625355092,2030760728,2244851822 

//notes:Add spamming build and arc shields: Swordmaster's guard, tireless blade, surrounded. 

dimwishlist:item=2857348871&perks=1261178282,269888150,2590710093,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=2857348871&perks=436053704,269888150,2590710093,3708227201


//notes:Support sword build: Energy Transfer and En Garde. En Garde does not mean light attack, it means an attack that happens quickly after swapping because there is a very narrow window to activate. You want to maximize efficiency in order to be able to heavy attack within the damage window (max energy heavy attacks do the most damage), so your best best is to use as little energy as possible for an individual block, so use enduring guard. Typical pattern might be shotgun-shotgun-sword heavy attack-block-use special to heal/close gap/reload-switch back to shotgun as soon as energy is recharged. Jagged Edge will give you the most punch."
dimwishlist:item=2857348871&perks=3666208348,599007201,2030760728,2244851822

//Falling Guillotine
//notes:Generic stack and whack build: Jagged Edge for more damage, Swordmaster guard for faster charge rate (heavy attack every 5), Relentless Attack and Whirlwind blade. You never want to block with this build because you lose your whirlwind stacks-- better to light attack back into range immediately after a stomp. Good for farm content.
dimwishlist:item=614426548&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3913600130

//notes:"Leaning into swords" build:Tireless blade + surrounded. Spamming heavy attacks is much more viable due to AoE affect can allow for faster trash cleanup. Surrounded + Surrounded Spec gives you a high-risk/high reward option to do substantial boss damage without building whirlwind stacks, making it a better choice for mobile bosses. Also, unlike Whirlwind blade, you can block without impacting your DPS and use mods to further increase your survivability and therefore the amount of time you can stay up close to the boss without dying. Maximize ammo even though Tireless Blade will be proccing frequently to allow you to use your sword more in the spaces leading up to the boss encounter.
dimwishlist:item=614426548&perks=1261178282,2349202967,2590710093,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=614426548&perks=436053704,2349202967,2590710093,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=614426548&perks=938542991,2349202967,2590710093,3708227201


//Negative Space
//notes:Disruption Break on a sword is unique and therefore worth holding on to one. Either Tireless Blade or Relentless Strikes is probably fine. There currently are not many (any?) situations in the game in which something with an elemental shield would survive long enough to make it worth having the kinetic debuff take effect. Possibly use case might be to lead with sword, proc disruption break, swap to shotgun, proc 1-2 punch, then melee to finish and do something based on melee kills. OR melee THEN trench barrel for more damage on an already debuffed target. Needs further testing.
dimwishlist:item=3629968765&perks=1749209109,1683379515 


//notes:Generic stack and whack build: Jagged Edge for more damage, Swordmaster guard for faster charge rate (heavy attack every 5), Relentless Attack and Whirlwind blade. You never want to block with this build because you lose your whirlwind stacks-- better to light attack back into range immediately after a stomp. Good for farm content.
dimwishlist:item=3629968765&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3913600130


//notes:"Leaning into swords" build:Tireless blade + surrounded. Spamming heavy attacks is much more viable due to AoE affect can allow for faster trash cleanup. Surrounded + Surrounded Spec gives you a high-risk/high reward option to do substantial boss damage without building whirlwind stacks, making it a better choice for mobile bosses. Also, unlike Whirlwind blade, you can block without impacting your DPS and use mods to further increase your survivability (vs damage) and therefore the amount of time you can stay up close to the boss without dying. Maximize ammo even though Tireless Blade will be proccing frequently to allow you to use your sword more in the spaces leading up to the boss encounter.
dimwishlist:item=3629968765&perks=1261178282,2349202967,1749209109,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3629968765&perks=436053704,2349202967,1749209109,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3629968765&perks=938542991,2349202967,1749209109,3708227201


//notes:Boss debuff roll: The primary purpose of this build is to keep up Flash Counter and not die, even at the cost of personal DPS. Burst Guard, Energy Transfer, Flash Counter. Most useful on Hunter because dodge is OP, then Warlock (get bumped away, pop rift, do ranged damage until it's time to debuff again) and then Titan (get bounced away, pop a barricade, and heal or DPS at range from cover).
dimwishlist:item=3629968765&perks=1261178282,3625355092,2030760728,2244851822


//Steel Sybil
//notes:Generic stack and whack build: Jagged Edge for more damage, Swordmaster guard for faster charge rate (heavy attack every 5), Relentless Attack and Whirlwind blade. You never want to block with this build because you lose your whirlwind stacks-- better to light attack back into range immediately after a stomp. Good for farm content.
dimwishlist:item=4230993599&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3913600130

//notes:The only viable PvP sword build: Tireless Blade + Assassin's blade. Either burst guard or enduring guard.
dimwishlist:item=4230993599&perks=3666208348,599007201,2590710093,354401740
dimwishlist:item=4230993599&perks=3666208348,3625355092,2590710093,354401740

//Temptation's Hook
//notes:"PvE: Generic stack and whack build: Jagged Edge for more damage, Swordmaster guard for faster charge rate (heavy attack after 5), Relentless Attack and Whirlwind blade. You never want to block with this build because you lose your whirlwind stacks-- better to light attack back into range immediately after a stomp. Tempered Edge gives you an extra heavy attack if you need it without hurting your damage. Good for farm content."
dimwishlist:item=35794111&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3913600130

//notes:"PvE: "Spam light attacks on Boss" build. Vorpal Weapon gives this build flexibility in ranged or close damage, and allows for blocking while up close for more survivability. We prefer high resistance on our blocks to stay in the fight longer."
dimwishlist:item=35794111&perks=3666208348,3625355092,1749209109,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=35794111&perks=938542991,3625355092,1749209109,1546637391

dimwishlist:item=35794111&perks=938542991,2349202967,1749209109,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=35794111&perks=2827049491,2349202967,1749209109,1546637391

//notes:"PvE: "All trash all the time" build. You can block to sustain more light damage attacks with Enduring Guard, and Tireless Blade keeps you topped off. Surrounded gives you the opportunity to focus on a major first before clearing out the trash for extra bonus damage."
dimwishlist:item=35794111&perks=1261178282,599007201,2590710093,3708227201

//notes:PvE: Another boss DPS build, but with a supporting twist. Blocking a stomp will debuff and disorient the boss, allowing a coordinated team the ability to kill the boss faster.
